{{Community}}
The term '''snapshotting''' refers to the state in which attributes are fixed on a long-lasting ability, effect, entity, or summon based on the character's attributes during the ability's activation. A snapshotted ability will not receive the additional buffs the character obtains after its activation.

For example, [[Xiangling]]'s [[Pyronado]] will receive the [[Attack|ATK Bonus]] for the entirety of its duration when cast inside [[Bennett]]'s [[Fantastic Voyage]] field &mdash; even if Xiangling walks outside the buff's area of effect or it expires prematurely. However, the ATK Bonus will not affect Pyronado if cast before Bennett's Fantastic Voyage - regardless of whether Xiangling stays in the buff's area of effect.

==Non-Snapshottable Buffs==
While most buffs function by modifying the target character's stats and can be snapshotted by the correct abilities, there are certain exceptions.

Such buffs do not modify the damage dealer's attributes, and instead directly apply to real-time damage calculations. Therefore, these buffs are ''unable to be snapshotted''.

As a general rule, if a buff results in a visible change in the target character's stat menu (e.g. ATK buffs, Elemental DMG Bonus buffs), it is snapshottable. If a buff does ''not'' result in a visible change in stats (e.g. Elemental Burst DMG Bonus buffs, Additive Base DMG Bonus buffs), it is non-snapshottable.
* Exceptions include the All DMG buffs provided by {{Item|Serpent Spine|20|type=weapon}}, {{Item|Iron Sting|20|type=weapon}}, {{Item|Primordial Jade Winged-Spear|20|type=weapon}}, {{Item|The Alley Flash|20|type=weapon}}, {{Item|Song of Stillness|20|type=weapon}}, {{Item|Fragment of Harmonic Whimsy|20}}, and {{Item|Unfinished Reverie|20}}, which are snapshottable despite not appearing in the menu.

The following tables are an exhaustive list of non-snapshottable buffs provided by character abilities and equipments. Any buffs not listed here are snapshottable.

==Talents==
There are several talents that can be intuitively determined to be non-snapshottable, some are not - as such, it is important to clarify and distinguish the two types:

*'''Snapshottable Talents''' - Attributes are fixed after a certain point during the ability activation.
*'''Non-Snapshottable Talents''' - Damage is recalculated during every instance of the ability's activation based on the character's current attributes.

<u>Note:</u> Most talents that were not included do not have a delay on their damage or effects upon their activation. Non-Snapshottable talents isn't an exhaustive list but is used to provide clarity to some talents that may have similar mechanics but do not snapshot.

==Elemental Reactions==
[[Elemental Reaction]]s receive bonuses based on [[Elemental Mastery]]. While Elemental Mastery can be snapshotted, certain Elemental Reactions will ignore the snapshotted Elemental Mastery and instead use the Elemental Mastery stat of the character at the moment the reaction is triggered.

{| class="wikitable"
! Elemental Reaction !! Uses Snapshotted EM
|-
| [[Melt]]<br>[[Vaporize]] || {{check|yes}}
|-
| [[Overloaded]]<br>[[Shattered]]<br>[[Electro-Charged]]<br>[[Superconduct]]<br>[[Swirl]]<br>[[Burning]]<br>[[Bloom]]<br>[[Hyperbloom]]<br>[[Burgeon]]<br>[[Aggravate]]<br>[[Spread]] || {{check|no}}
|}

For example, the [[Superconduct]] damage triggered by [[Ganyu]]'s [[Celestial Shower]] will be boosted by [[Sucrose]]'s [[Catalyst Conversion]] even after Ganyu's talent is cast.
